title: Krishna Consciousness Is the Highest Rasa! | Soulful Japa
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Maharaj

segments.key_quote: The whole path of Bhakti as well as the goal of Bhakti, destination of Bhakti is from Rasa.
segments.summary: This segment introduces the concept of Rasa as good experience and its central role in the path and goal of Bhakti.
segments.transcript: We all want good experience. We are all living entities, meaning experiential beings. Everybody likes experience, good experience. Good experience is called Rasa. The whole path of Bhakti, as well as the goal of Bhakti, the destination of Bhakti, is from Rasa.

segments.key_quote: We come to Krishna consciousness hoping for freedom Rasa.
segments.summary: This segment explains that Krishna consciousness offers various types of Rasa, including knowledge, love, and freedom from material bondage.
segments.transcript: The whole school of Rasa is Bhakti Rasa. For instance, why are we chanting? Why have we come into Krishna consciousness? Because even in the knowledge that Krishna is the Supreme Absolute Truth, there is a knowledge Rasa, knowing Rasa. Apart from that, you know, His attractive nature, God is a reservoir of all love, and we are His part and parcel. So there also there is Rasa, loving Rasa. The material world, a world of karma, no freedom, bondage. We come to Krishna consciousness hoping for freedom Rasa. We get freedom from these material modes of nature.

segments.key_quote: Japa is giving us an access to an ocean of Rasa.
segments.summary: This segment emphasizes that we are all seeking Rasa and that Krishna consciousness, particularly through Japa, provides access to an ocean of Sat, Chit, and Ananda Rasa.
segments.transcript: Let me experience my true freedom to love Krishna. So we are all Rasa beings, and our seeking of Rasa is what we are seeking in Krishna consciousness also through different ways. And there is no better understanding of Japa, better perception of Japa, than thinking that Japa is giving us access to an ocean of Rasa: Sat Rasa, Chit Rasa, and Ananda Rasa.

segments.key_quote: The absolute truth Krishna is a supreme ocean of Rasa.
segments.summary: This segment describes Krishna as the supreme ocean of Rasa (Akila Rasa Amrita Sindhu) and contrasts this with a limited understanding of God as merely the controller of the material world.
segments.transcript: The ocean of Rasa. Who does not want it? We are Rasa beings. The Absolute Truth, Krishna, is a supreme ocean of Rasa. He is Akila Rasa Amrita Sindhu. Akila Rasa Amrita Sindhu. All Rasas, Sindhu ocean, Amrita, sweet, nectarian. That is why we are all after Krishna consciousness, not simply some God who is sitting and ruling everything. There is a very small aspect. It is a fact that He is ruling this material world.

segments.key_quote: Krishna is the controller of this material world. All these are dry for Bhaktas.
segments.summary: This segment uses the analogy of a prison to illustrate that understanding Krishna only as the controller of the material world is a limited and dry perspective for devotees, representing Shanta Rasa.
segments.transcript: There are all very small aspects of Krishna. You cannot understand the glories of what the country is by understanding everything that is around, by trying to understand what goes on in the prison in the country. In the prison in the country, very nicely you are running the prison. You understand who is the superintendent, who is the controller. He is the controller and all this. It is all dry. Krishna is the controller of this material world. All these are dry for Bhaktas. It is Shanta Rasa. It is also Rasa.

segments.key_quote: Krishna Consciousness is the highest Rasa.
segments.summary: This segment explains that Bhakti Rasa involves an active relationship with Krishna and is our original Rasa, contrasting it with the fleeting and disconnected Rasas of the material world, and reiterating Sat, Chit, and Ananda.
segments.transcript: Shanta Rasa. Bhakti Rasa is Rasa of active relationship with Krishna: Dasya, Sakya, Dasya Rasa, Sakya Rasa, Vatsalya Rasa, Madhurya Rasa. Even Shanta Rasa is so wonderful for a Rasa-starved living entity in this material world. Even Sakya Rasa, even Shanta Rasa, where there is no active exchange of relationship, but there is appreciating Rasa of the greatness of the Supreme Lord, His creation. We need to understand, we need to always know that we are Rasa beings, and Krishna Consciousness is the highest Rasa. Krishna Consciousness is the path for us to experience. Our highest Rasa is also our original Rasa. In the material world, we run after this Rasa, that Rasa, so many Rasas. Actually, they are all not connected to us, but Krishna Rasa or Bhakti Rasa is our original Rasa.
